meta.description: Family members, common foods, everyday objects, and telling time in German.

module.name: Daily Life
module.description: Learn vocabulary for family, food, everyday objects, and time expressions.

lessons.title: Family and Daily Words
lessons.description: Learn essential vocabulary for family members, common foods, and household items.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'mother' in German?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Mutter' is mother. 'Mama' is mom (informal).

quiz_questions.question: What does 'Bruder' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Bruder' means brother. 'Schwester' is sister.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'water' in German?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Wasser' means water. It's neuter: das Wasser.

quiz_questions.question: What is 'Brot' in English?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Brot' means bread in German.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'table' in German?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Tisch' means table. It's masculine: der Tisch.

lessons.title: Possessives and Haben/Sein
lessons.description: Learn possessive adjectives and master haben (to have) and sein (to be).

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'my mother' in German?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Meine' is used for feminine nouns: meine Mutter.

quiz_questions.question: 'Ich habe zwei Brüder' means:
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Ich habe' = I have. 'Zwei Brüder' = two brothers (note the umlaut).

quiz_questions.question: Which is correct for 'my house'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Mein Haus' - neuter nouns use 'mein' in nominative.

quiz_questions.question: Complete: 'Wir ___ Deutsche' (We are German)
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Sind' is the wir form of sein (to be).

quiz_questions.question: Complete: 'Sie ___ Hunger' (They have hunger = They are hungry)
quiz_questions.explanation: In German, you 'have' hunger: 'Hunger haben'. Sie haben Hunger.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'our house'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Unser' means 'our'. Neuter nominative: unser Haus.

quiz_questions.question: 'Er ist Arzt' means:
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Ist' (sein) + profession. No article needed in German.

quiz_questions.question: Possessive adjectives in German must agree with:
quiz_questions.explanation: German possessives change based on gender, number, and case of the noun.

lessons.title: Family Conversations
lessons.description: Practice talking about your family and daily routines.

quiz_questions.question: How do you ask 'Do you have siblings?' in German?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Hast du Geschwister?' uses 'haben' (to have).

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'I live with my family'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Ich wohne mit meiner Familie' - 'wohnen' means to live/reside.

quiz_questions.question: What does 'Wie spät ist es?' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Wie spät ist es?' literally 'How late is it?' = What time is it?

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'It's 3 o'clock'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Es ist drei Uhr' - 'Uhr' means clock/o'clock.

quiz_questions.question: How do you respond to 'Wie viele Geschwister hast du?'
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Ich habe drei Geschwister' answers how many siblings.

lessons.title: Reading About Daily Life
lessons.description: Read and understand texts about family and daily routines.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Meine Familie ist groß. Ich habe drei Brüder.' How many brothers?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Drei Brüder' means three brothers.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Ich frühstücke um acht Uhr.' When does the person eat breakfast?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Um acht Uhr' means at eight o'clock.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Meine Mutter kocht jeden Tag.' What does the mother do?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Kocht' means 'she cooks'. 'Kochen' = to cook.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Wir wohnen in einem kleinen Haus, aber es ist gemütlich.' The house is:
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Klein aber gemütlich' = small but cozy.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Sonntags essen wir mit den Großeltern zu Mittag.' When do they lunch with grandparents?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Sonntags' means on Sundays.

lessons.title: Days and Time Expressions
lessons.description: Learn to understand days of the week and time expressions.

quiz_questions.question: Which day sounds like 'MOHN-tahk'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Montag' (Monday) is pronounced 'MOHN-tahk'.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'Saturday' in German?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Samstag' is Saturday. 'Sonntag' is Sunday.

quiz_questions.question: German days of the week are:
quiz_questions.explanation: German days are capitalized because all nouns in German are capitalized.

quiz_questions.question: What does 'das Wochenende' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Das Wochenende' literally means 'the week-end' = weekend.

quiz_questions.question: Which day sounds like 'MIT-vokh'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Mittwoch' (Wednesday) means 'mid-week'.
